posts.cooked:
Hello, thank you for Signal.

Polls, in a group chat context, are extremely useful tools: they can help chose a movie, a restaurant, a place for a drink… or organize for the next training/match (who will be there, who is available or not), pick a date for meetup, you name it.

I am involved in various sports and various teams and so far, we have been organizing on Facebook. The pattern is always the same, we have a specific group for a specific team and every week, one of the players creates a poll asking who’s “present”, “absent”, “available if need be”.

Over the years, I have managed to get people to ditch Messenger, Facebook, whatever instant messaging app because Signal reached features parity with them (the features that these specific users used [i.e. mostly sending pictures, videos and files]). In the sports team context described above, most players have a Facebook account mainly for the purpose of answering these polls.

Is there any chance that this feature could be considered and, one day, see the light in Signal?

Best,
GN

posts.name: elsa
posts.cooked:
As signal can be use within a group, one request which could be very intersting is to add a survey or vote system like telegram do it.
i use signal with a group of personn and its boring to use mail or telegramm for simple votes

yes-no-pearhaps

hopefully i’m clear .sorry for my English

sqygirl:

boring to use mail or telegramm for simple votes

I agree with Elsa 100% on this :-) Plus, that process is considerably less privacy-respecting, since email and telegram are not as privacy-oriented as signalapp. This feature-request is not new, there are other folks who also agree:

  • 2015, earliest written example of the feature request I found, Poll Feature · Issue #2551 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub closed by then-OWS-developer mcginty as “not a priority compared to multimedia” (back when signalapp was significantly behind in e.g. video calls and such… which is no longer the case methinks)
  • 2017, best overview of the need, Support for polls/surveys · Issue #6646 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
  • some forum-threads were mentioned here == Survey or vote system like telegram - #2 by PiCob
  • 2017, earliest forum thread I could find, Feature Idea : Poll feature

And this thread is from 2018, perhaps a forum-moderator can move it over to merge it with the 2017 forum-thread on the same feature-request please?

Or maybe this one should be kept separate, since it is specifically talking about groupchat-related polls. This tends to be more valuable than 1-on-1 chats, though, so I suspect it is all the same feature-request.

One thing that groupchats might want to hold a poll about, which is more of an internal thing than where the group should have lunch, or what the group should spend their petty cash fund upon next summer, or similar kinds of topics, is related to the another feature-request: groupchat admins. At some point it will be possible to create a groupchat which has a groupchat-admin, or ideally, which has multiple groupchat-members that are giving groupchat-admin permissions and powers.

But who decides, which groupchat members ought to have admin-powers? Well, the obvious thing to do is hold a poll, or a survey, or an election: “choose your top five people from the 99-member groupchat that you would like to be admins during the first half of 2020.” Or maybe ranked-choice-voting, rather than approval-voting. There are actually a lot of complicated ways to hold a survey, beyond the simplest choose-only-one-option-multiple-choice kind of thing with radiobuttons by each available choice.

Similarly, the same kind of polling/voting/survey system would be useful when it was necessary to have somebody removed from the groupchat involuntarily (one of the MAIN reasons to have groupchat-admins at all methinks). But rather than have the groupchat-admins exercise their power in the form of a judge+jury+executioner kind of style, it is more useful to be able to have some internal polls. Preferably with secret ballot type results, where the cryptography guarantees that nobody voted more than once, and that nobody spoofed any other person’s vote, but the groupchat admins cannot tell which groupchat members voted which way? But at least, the basic ability to say “dear groupchat should Bob be kicked off the island? y/n” type of thing.

I consider this to be a “medium-term” feature request, whereas the more straightforward kinds of polls (as explained well in github#6646 above) which are going to be useful to everyday folks trying to plan luncheons, figure out who is coming to the next meeting, decide on crunchy versus creamy, and other “external topics” … those should be the priority. But there are a lot of interesting use-cases here, where a polling-and-survey-and-voting feature could be applied to improve the enjoyability and effectiveness of groupchats themselves… and how they are admin’d… not just of external events out in the physical world. See also Improving Signal group chats for more ideas.

p.s. NOT really related, except tangentially, is the idea of getting a polling&survey-system up and running for the signalUsers forum, where people can vote on what their favorite feature-requests are. Poll builder: prioritize feature requests One of my favorite feature-requests, would be a polling&survey system implemented right inside signalapp groupchats, of course ;-)

posts.name: C4ne
posts.cooked:
So I noticed that yesterday in a WhatsApp Group:
Finding a date for, lets say a party, is a pretty exhausting task to do, especially in a large group.
Here is my suggestion:
A person can upload a “date” in a group. He has to select at least one or more dates. All group members can now select when they have time. If there’s a date which all members can agree on, the message will get a green tick and will display the date.

Further suggestions:

  • The creator can select how many people must agree on the same date so the date becomes set
  • The creator can optionally set a specific time(span) for every date

I really really think that would be a great feature which could, at least, put us ahead of WhatsApp. Though I’ve never been in a large group in signal.

Nice idea, however there are other tools for that already existing. E.g., doodle.com

Also, there are numerous things that have to be considered. Where will this “date selector” be placed? Is it always pinned to the bottom? What happens if someone posts something different in between? What happens if not enough people answer? Will this date stay always pinned and steal precious screen space? Can anyone cancel the date finding process or only the initiator?

posts.name: C4ne
posts.cooked:
Yeah, that’s right. But I don’t quite see why this would be an argument against implementing such a feature. This may be an option for young and technophile people but not for older people I think.
Personally I don’t want to create an account on that platform solely to make out a date with some people.

A function to make out a date in a large group

Also, there are numerous things that have to be considered. Where will this “date selector” be placed? Is it always pinned to the bottom? What happens if someone posts something different in between? What happens if not enough people answer? Will this date stay always pinned and steal precious screen space? Can anyone cancel the date finding process or only the initiator?

I intendedly left out a couple of questions because, I really dont know anything about the signal protocol and what can be easily implemented and what not. And secondly I think a feature request has more potential if theres more room for discussion and for other people to share their thoughts, here are mine:

A function to make out a date in a large group

Where will this “date selector” be placed?

As all people can post a date, they should be all shown as quite normal text messages

A function to make out a date in a large group

Is it always pinned to the bottom?

Is there someone like a group leader in a signal group? Maybe his dates could be pinned somewhere.

A function to make out a date in a large group

What happens if someone posts something different in between?

I don’t quite get that question. The chat just goes on. If its really long there is a possibility that someone overlooks the “date” message

A function to make out a date in a large group

What happens if not enough people answer?

That’s an acutally good question. Maybe we could add something like a timer, as this is kind of a poll? Would that even make sense? I would say there’s just no date that all can agree upon.
A drastic solution would be: All users are blocked until they finish that date message, but that could go backwards if someone starts spamming date messages.

A function to make out a date in a large group

Will this date stay always pinned and steal precious screen space? Can anyone cancel the date finding process or only the initiator?

As I said previously, its thought to be more like a message. I would say that the process is finished if the minimum amount of people could agree on a date or the initiator cancels it.

Greets

Hi folks, Threema, a messenger from Switzerland has this poll feature, which is pretty nice. It would be great to have it in Signal.
Here is a short video presenting the poll function

Also see Group chat polls

A function to make out a date in a large group

Personally I don’t want to create an account on that platform solely to make out a date with some people

You don’t have to. It works without registration/account.

A function to make out a date in a large group

I don’t quite see why this would be an argument against implementing such a feature

Well, I see one: In my opinion surveys are a completely different domain and nothing that belongs to a messenger (I’d even consider it bloatware… since I’m using Threema as well, I know what I’m talking about). I think there are enough good alternative services available and the devs already have more than enough to do (just have a look at the bug tracker or how many basic features are still missing!). Providing such a survey feature is really a damn high load of work.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I think the most important reason not to integrate a poll feature is because people using Signal to chat would also have to accept that their friends start using Signals own poll feature. If they don’t like the poll feature, they also wont like Signal as a messaging app because you can’t really opt out of friends using that poll feature. Keeping apps seperate keeps that free choise to use a different polling system of your liking.

This is my opinion on polling, voting, scedualing and status updates. It’s better to keep each task in own app, to keep free choice which feature you do or do not embrace.

Meteor0id:

I think the most important reason not to integrate a poll feature is because people using Signal to chat would also have to accept that their friends start using Signals own poll feature. If they don’t like the poll feature, they also wont like Signal as a messaging app because you can’t really opt out of friends using that poll feature.

What is there about a poll feature that people would need to opt out of? You can “opt out” by not voting in the poll. Polls could very easily be optional (on a conversation level) as well – for starters, polls don’t really make any sense in one-on-one conversations, so they could simply not exist there. Additionally, in group conversations, polls could be an optional feature that could be enabled/disabled for that specific conversation (of course, this would require group conversations to have a much different structure than they have currently).

From my experience, polls are a very useful feature for group conversations, especially ones with large numbers of users when you are trying to make decisions on things. Adding a feature like this will allow such activities to continue conveniently and securely, without users having to rely on likely non-secure outside tools.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Herohtar:

What is there about a poll feature that people would need to opt out of?

The poll system.

Say I really dislike a certain poll system because it won’t let me add a note to my vote, or it wont let me cast multiple votes, I could just ask my friends to use another polling website. But if Signal already has some poll feature build in, conveinience will win over quality and some people will refuse to use an external polling site. It is unlikely Signal will ever offer an highly configarable poll system, so lets not integrate sonething we can’t do right. Rather few things which work very well, than many things which somewhat work. Lets focus on messaging, if we want polls lets make a seperate poll app. Which you can open eith a poll intent from within Signal.

Meteor0id:

if Signal already has some poll feature build in, conveinience will win over quality and some people will refuse to use an external polling site.

As they should, if you are aiming for privacy with the entirety of your conversation. But even without polls in Signal, someone could just as easily refuse to use a different polling site just because you dislike the one they’re currently using, so you have the same situation either way.

Meteor0id:

It is unlikely Signal will ever offer an highly configarable poll system, so lets not integrate sonething we can’t do right.

So it’s really about you not believing that the Signal devs can implement a good poll feature.

I agree that additional features should be done well and not be released in a broken state, but there is nothing wrong with implementing a simple version of a feature with plans to expand on it later. I also agree that messaging features should get priority for implementation and improvement, but I would argue that polls (particularly as part of decision making) are a messaging feature and should be included on that list. Priority can be debated, but much better to include it at a low priority than exclude it entirely.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Starting with Signal v4.61 for Android and Signal v3.10 for iOS, you can react to messages with any emoji. For right now, you can use this feature to create polls.

Example:

What movie should we watch tonight?
- Pirates of the Caribbean
- Avengers
- Spiderman

Then other people in the group chat could vote by reacting to your message with one of those emoji. There are so many different voting options thanks to this new feature.

posts.cooked: Still waiting for the iOS release as well. As of now, those wouldn’t be able to participate in a poll.

accepted_answer.name: Salt
accepted_answer.excerpt:
Signal Messenger

Signal Polls: Yes, no, maybe (yes!)

Signal polling: An easier way to see what your group chat really thinks and feels.

Signal Polls are now live on Android, iOS, and Desktop, so I’m going to close this feature request

Any future requests for additional poll functionality should be submitted as a new feature request.
